name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"c09df81d-42d2-4dc3-bd07-dd3b33974d70","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Documentation: Lookup & State Resolution","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ae703fff-1be1-4a9d-807b-f70600f884be","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group of methods handles the "Intelligence and Retrieval" phase of the analysis. Once the structure is built and populated, these tools allow the analyzer to query the hierarchy and manage the versioning of scopes during complex execution paths (like loops or conditional branches).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7d3e25d1-5ddc-4e7b-9be6-a5be58647ba3","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"3cd09201-2eb0-4528-82fc-265e0665b98f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Functional Purpose","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"87dff34d-d7ef-4802-9af4-e3a03c0ec5da","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The primary goal of this group is ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Contextual Navigation","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". These methods enable the analyzer to behave like a Python interpreter by looking up variables in the correct order of visibility and tracking how data state changes as the analysis moves through different sequences of the same namespace.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"21fe7360-2b6b-4ed1-b805-c8cd975e79db","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"2abec41c-59e2-4acb-83e2-c6a8ea1d1424","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method Details","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6d736f6b-7627-4ec8-a7f3-e211d31a66a4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_def

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"This is the core implementation of ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Python’s Scoping Rules","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". When the analyzer sees a variable name, it calls this method. It first checks the immediate local scope. If the variable isn't found, it uses a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"while","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" loop to "climb" up the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"parent","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" links (from function to class to module). It returns the first definition it encounters or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"None","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if the variable is truly undefined.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6fb6392b-4dc3-4330-a419-dd6b5ffcf0ed","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" & ","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"get_scopes

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These are the primary accessors for the manager’s data. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_scope","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" retrieves a specific ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" instance using its unique namespace string. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_scopes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" returns the entire internal dictionary, providing a global view of every environment tracked by the framework.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e07ab25a-8bf0-4f74-93db-80dbb9f64fdc","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_seq

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Increments and returns a "Sequence Number" for a specific namespace. This is essential for distinguishing between different temporal states of the same scope. For example, if a loop runs multiple times, each "iteration" can be assigned a sequence number to keep their data states isolated from one another.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dfbed4d4-e2e7-4920-8156-8edb810250fd","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_seq

","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A retrieval tool that returns the current sequence count for a namespace. If a namespace has never been sequenced, it safely returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"0","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This allows the analyzer to check which "version" of a scope it is currently interacting with.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1750a8e4-59f0-494a-bf15-a954f19d358d","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"aa75aa67-7ded-4301-985c-44aeab5a7504","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why This Group Matters","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"511b78e6-3871-4f3a-b22c-521a92dfb427","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group provides the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Logical Depth","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" required for accurate static analysis:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fed9be8c-1fb9-465f-8aff-6b5d673aa0cc","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Resolution Accuracy","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ensures that if a function uses a global variable, the analyzer correctly links the usage to the global definition rather than assuming it's a missing local variable.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"99b0378b-0a31-40f1-8f86-52d856547779","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Snapshot Management","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"add_seq","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_seq","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" allow the framework to handle "State Explosions." By versioning namespaces, the analyzer can track how a variable's value might change over multiple passes of a loop without losing the history of previous iterations.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"459c88a4-66bc-4d49-b8de-fb3227696c3e","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Framework Connectivity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": These methods act as the interface between the high-level AST visitors (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_ClassDef","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and the low-level data stored in individual ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ScopeItem","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4b9ffa08-a96f-4312-a278-454fcbd2e8c9","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
